Paragraph: Neither ECG [ sinus - cycle length ( SCL ) , QT or QTc interval , or U wave ] nor clinical parameters identified patients at risk for torsades de pointes .

| Disease |
| --- |
| Torsades de pointes |

In this paragraph, the disease entity mentioned is "torsades de pointes." The other entities mentioned (sinus cycle length, QT or QTc interval, and U wave) are not diseases but rather clinical parameters used to assess the risk of torsades de pointes.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Neither ECG [ sinus - cycle length ( SCL ) , QT or QTc interval , or U wave ] nor clinical parameters identified patients at risk for torsades de pointes .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| ECG |
| sinus - cycle length (SCL) |
| QT interval |
| QTc interval |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| QT interval |
| QTc interval |

Explanation:

ECG is not a chemical entity, but an abbreviation for Electrocardiogram, which is a medical test that measures the electrical activity of the heart. Sinus-cycle length (SCL) is also not a chemical entity, but a measurement of the time between two consecutive R waves in an ECG trace. Therefore, only QT interval and QTc interval are valid chemical entities in this paragraph, as they refer to specific intervals measured in an ECG trace.
